result.execSummary:
The defendant Roderick Richard Alire was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:58 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael R. Cohen in court for Roderick Richard Alire.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin. INCLUDES 20CF687 (MH), 22CF85 (PLEAS) and 22TR408 (STC). 20CF687: Court reviews file, Motion to Revoke DJOC filed. DE does not object to revocation of DJOC. Court revokes DJOC. 22CF85: DE sworn. Atty. Cohen recites agreement. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - OWI 2nd in 22CF85. DE sworn. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - OWI 2nd in 22CF85. Sentencing arguments. DE completed AODA and Restorative Justice programming. Court enters judgment of conviction on 20CF687. Defendant advised of appeal rights. OFF RECORD: Court dismisses 22TR408.
 
Court orders: 
20CF687
Ct 1 - Substantial Battery - Intend Bodily Harm
S/W 2 years probation with conditions:
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Random testing at least one time per month by Agent
- Complete Domestic Abuse assessment and follow any recommendations
- No abusive contact with J. A. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections 
- Court Costs $268; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $250; payable through Clerk of Court
44 days jail credit

22CF85
Ct 1 - OWI 2nd
6 months jail - Huber authorized and eligible for Good Time
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Follow through with Driver's Safety Plan
- 14 months driver's license revocation
- 14 months IID
- Fine $1,492; inclusive of costs and surcharge
- Fees $1,355, payable to JSC; to be paid out of bond
- DNA Sample

Defendant to report to jail no later than 11/10/2022.
Defendant to report to probation no later than 2:00 pm today, 11/1/22.
Apply bond on file, payment plan approved.

Filed by DA's Office. km
Status conference on February 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least THREE times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sarah K.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
